definitions.definition: the surface of the earth that is not covered by water:
examples: It is cheaper to drill for oil on land than at sea.

definitions.definition: an area of ground, especially when used for a particular purpose such as farming or building:
examples: This sort of land is no good for growing potatoes.
Most of the families lived off the land (= grew their own food, etc.).

definitions.definition: to (cause to) arrive on the ground or other surface after moving down through the air:
examples: We should land in Madrid at 7 a.m.

definitions.definition: to arrive on land from the sea:
examples: We landed at Port Said in the early evening.

definitions.definition: to arrive at or appear on a particular website:
examples: If you click on the link you land on his blog.
